IKP EDEN had the pleasure of hosting Kei Iiyama and Dr. Sharath R from Sakra Hospitals. It was an insightful introductory meeting where we showcased the work IKP Knowledge Park and IKP EDEN are doing to support innovation and nurture high-impact hardware & deeptech startups

Startups like Cureous Cartosense and others had the opportunity to engage with the Sakra team and share their journeys and technologies. We also had the opportunity to walk them through our facility and the infrastructure we provide to early-stage ventures.

IKP EDEN is excited about the potential synergies and are looking forward to co-creating opportunities that can accelerate MedTech innovation and deliver scalable healthcare solutions.
Collaboration like this strengthens the ecosystem—and we're just getting started!

𝐀 𝐩𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫𝐟𝐮𝐥 𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐯𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭! 

We are constantly inspired by purpose-driven solutions that tackle critical public health challenges at the grassroots.
 
Bengaluru-based Janitri Innovations, an IKP-supported, startup quietly transforming maternal and newborn health through frugal innovation, is a powerful reminder that big change often begins with small, thoughtful steps.
 
We celebrate ventures that combine empathy and engineering to create scalable, life-saving interventions.
 
Janitri is supported by programs like AGC JanCARE, a part of our portfolio, and is incubated at IKP EDEN. As ecosystem enablers, stories like these reinforce our belief in nurturing science and technology for inclusive growth.

👉 Read more: https://lnkd.in/gU32aXiM

A big congratulations to Lamark Biotech, one of the deep science startups nurtured at IKP, for raising ₹6.5 crore in a pre-Series A funding round led by IAN Group (formerly Indian Angel Network), including IAN Alpha Fund, powered by BioAngels, to advance innovation in protein-based drugs, such as insulin, monoclonal antibodies, and enzymes, for pharma and nutraceuticals.

A recipient of the Biotechnology Ignition Grant (BIG 18), Lamark’s proprietary innovation, ProteoStrong, can greatly stabilise the drug, extending its shelf life, thereby improving the accessibility and affordability of molecular medicines. 

This milestone is a testament to the power of research-driven biotech and the growing investor confidence in science-led enterprises from India.

👉 Read more: https://lnkd.in/gsHVvqmp  

#IKPStartups #Biopharma #DeepScience #Innovation #StartupFunding #MakeInIndia #EnzymeTechnology #HyderabadInnovation

Dr. Kumar has been at the forefront of shaping India's biotech and innovation landscape, fostering an ecosystem where groundbreaking ideas can thrive and scale. His leadership at BIRAC has empowered countless startups, scientists, and entrepreneurs to transform bold visions into reality.
Having him grace the forum as our Chief Guest is not just an honour—it is an opportunity for all aspiring founders and investors to hear from one of the most influential voices in India’s biotech revolution.

We are proud to announce the inauguration of our R&D Centre for Intracellular Therapeutics, a space that brings our science, purpose, and people together under one roof!🎉

The event was short yet deeply meaningful, graced by the presence of the Hon’ble Consul General of Ireland, Ms. Anita Kelly, and her team, who toured our new facility and engaged with our scientists. We were also honored to host Mr. Rishaad Currimjee, one of our recent investors, whose support continues to drive our growth. 

At the heart of this celebration was a reflection on why we do what we do. As shared by our Founder & CEO, Dr. Nusrat Sanghamitra, this journey began with a deeply personal mission: to make cancer treatments safer and less toxic. From a PhD bench at IISc to pioneering intracellular drug delivery solutions, that vision has evolved into GEENIE, our proprietary platform to overcome the bottlenecks of modern drug development. 

Our heartfelt thanks to the Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) BIG Grant and KIIT-Technology Business Incubator for their early support, which helped lay the foundation of our journey. We did not miss remembering all our esteemed investors, partners, and well-wishers for their warm wishes for the occasion  unwavering support of our journey and belief in our vision, which has been instrumental in keeping us motivated continuously.  

Behind every experiment is a human story. Behind every breakthrough, a relentless team. This new center is more than just a lab. It’s a symbol of our commitment to transforming lives, molecule by molecule. 
 
We're just getting started. 
 
3i Partners Golden Sparrow SOSV VOYAGERS.io Celesta Capital Ankur Capital Venture Center (Official Account) DBT BIRAC Premnath Venugopalan Manisha Premnath Bill Liao Satya Prakash Dash Sean O'Sullivan Sami Mikati David Rowan SK Fazlul Krishnan Sharaf Yamani  Kavya Agarwal JB Michel Imran Nasrullah, MS Erin Mistry Michael S. We extend our deepest gratitude to BIRAC-FIRST Hub for their steadfast support of India’s biotech innovation ecosystem. As a facilitation unit addressing everything from regulatory navigation and funding to intellectual property and market access, FIRST Hub plays a critical role in helping startups grow with confidence.

At Serigen, we are especially grateful for the regulatory clarity and mentorship we've received from BIRAC-FIRST Hub. With their support, we’ve been able to accelerate our journey through approvals and ensure compliance, allowing us to focus on what matters most: delivering high-quality tissue engineering solutions to patients.

Thank you for empowering biotech innovation in India - one startup at a time. We’re proud to be part of this growing ecosystem! Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC), DBT BIRAC, Sonia Gandhi

On #NationalScienceDay2025, CCAMP is excited to share some of its work that demonstrates the power of science to solve societal problems 

We are proud to be fostering several next gen deep-science based innovative solutions and research that are bridging critical gaps in healthcare, agriculture and environment

Some of these include
🧪Mitigating antimicrobial resistance, strengthening maternal and child health, treating degenerative illnesses and cancer, and developing diagnostics for infectious diseases,
🧪Replacing chemical pesticides with biologicals, boosting crop productivity and farmer incomes, and increasing food security
 🧪Capturing carbon and adopting climate resilient solutions

And, much more!

Presenting you a short film on the C-CAMP ecosystem where young ideas are born, deep science questions are pursued, nurtured and empowered to leapfrog to global leadership

IT BT Department, Karnataka, Sujith J Chandy, Ex. Dir., ICARS, Dr. Lata Kapoor, Addl. Dir. National Centre for Disease Control, Kamini Walia, Head, Research Division Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR), and Prof. LS SHASHIDHARA, Dir National Centre for Biological Sciences

Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD, Dr Jitendra Singh, NITI Aayog, Embassy of Denmark in India, Embassy of India Copenhagen, Dr Renu Swarup, Freddy Svane, Eske Bo Rosenberg, Jakob Williams Ørberg, Novo Nordisk Foundation, Henrik Caspar Wegener, 
Dinesh Gundu Rao,  Priyank M Kharge, Department of Biotechnology, India DST, World Health Organization, Global Antibiotic R&D Partnership (GARDP), Gates Foundation India, Gates Foundation, Wellcome Trust, Innovation Centre Denmark, Innovation Centre Denmark Bangalore,  Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC), DBT BIRAC

C-CAMP today hosted the India AMR Innovation Workshop under the India AMR Innovation Hub (#IAIH), with strategic guidance from Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India. 

Top stakeholders from across the AMR ecosystem came together to discuss, deliberate and roadmap India’s AMR priorities. We also featured an exclusive showcase of the technologies supported under IAIH.

In his inaugural talk, Prof. Ajay Sood, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Govt of India and Chair of the C-CAMP-anchored #IAIH.“At this crucial juncture, as India prepares its National Action Plan 2.0 on AMR, such workshops will provide insights and help frame better policies.” He emphasised on the power of national and international collaboration in addressing the multidimensional challenges of AMR.

Dr. Ekroop Caur, IAS, Secy. IT BT Department, Karnataka, in her address noted: “AMR is not just a public health crisis; it poses a significant threat to economic development and societal growth at large. Our recently unveiled Biotech Policy identifies AMR as a key focus area for intervention, reflecting the Government of Karnataka’s commitment to addressing this challenge through innovation and collaboration." She also added, "We need a collective, coordinated effort to tackle AMR, and what I see here today through the India AMR Innovation Hub is a promising start — many stakeholders coming together in one room, collaborating to address a shared challenge."

CCAMP Dir- CEO Dr Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD added, “We are delighted to host this first-of-a-kind workshop under the India AMR Innovation Hub umbrella chaired by Prof. Sood, PSA, which aims to convene a robust national network of stakeholders, including researchers, innovators, policymakers, healthcare providers, and industry leaders working in cross sectoral AMR domain. We look forward to working together to foster solutions for AMR by leveraging cutting-edge research and contribute to policy making at the Central and State levels to combat this huge global threat.”
........
Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD Dr Jitendra Singh, ICMR, 
Department of Health and Family Welfare Services - Govt. of Karnataka Priyank M Kharge, Dinesh Gundu Rao, Dr. Ekroop Caur, IT BT Department, Karnataka, National Centre for Disease Control

🔍 Workshop Highlight | Understanding Patents & IP Management for Startup Success.

IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized an insightful workshop titled "Understanding Patent & IP Management: Basic Processes for Startup Success", led by Sneha Kanitkar, Founder of PatentSky.

The session focused on empowering early-stage entrepreneurs with essential knowledge to legally protect their technologies and innovations. Key topics included:

 📌 Filing processes for various types of Intellectual Property (IP)
 📌 Tangible vs. intangible assets
 📌 Overview of Patents, Copyrights, Trademarks, and Trade Secrets
 📌 Terms and scope of IP protection

🌟 Introducing: Gen AI for Business – Women’s Special Edition
📍 By Prof. Lina Sonne Vyas, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay

We’re excited to announce an exclusive, women-only course designed for professionals from diverse business and professional backgrounds who want to explore the real-world power of Generative AI (Gen AI) — even if they’re just starting out!

Whether you’re a team leader, entrepreneur, freelancer, or someone looking to boost your daily work productivity, this course is built to help you understand and apply Gen AI to transform your work.

🎯 Who is this course for?
✅ Women professionals with no or limited prior knowledge of Gen AI
✅ Employees keen to improve daily efficiency using Gen AI tools
✅ Managers and leaders wanting to integrate AI into team strategy and innovation
✅ Entrepreneurs and freelancers looking to multitask smarter and scale their impact

🧠 Why this course matters:
-Learn how GenAI is changing business workflows
-Understand practical applications, not just theory
-Discover how AI-driven insights can enhance productivity and creativity

📅 Limited seats available.

Are you giving used glass a new purpose?

Join the Circular Economy Incubation Program, an initiative by Pernod Ricard India Foundation, in partnership with NSRCEL. This program is designed to support early-stage startups working in Glass circularity, plastic circularity or climate smart agriculture.

If your solution focuses on glass cleaning or material innovation - from creating systems for safe reuse to developing new applications using recycled glass, this is your opportunity to take it forward.

The program offers:
 🔹 Sector-specific guidance
 🔹 Fundraising and revenue model readiness
 🔹 Go-to-market strategies for circular ventures
 🔹 Ecosystem connects 

Help close the loop on glass - build a solution that creates real circular value.

📅 Applications are closing soon!

🔗 Apply here: https://lnkd.in/gm-dVQWN

MeitY Startup Hub

🎓 Academia Meets Innovation at DERBI Foundation! 🧠🚀

We were delighted to welcome faculty members from the Dayananda Sagar Business Academy as part of a Faculty Development Program (FDP) aimed at bridging the gap between academic knowledge and entrepreneurial application.

The session included an engaging walkthrough of DERBI Foundation’s lab and Dayananda Sagar University's innovation campus at Kudlu Gate, where faculty had the opportunity to experience the startup ecosystem up close, from ideation spaces to prototyping labs, and incubation support facilities.

The visit sparked meaningful conversations around how real-world problem-solving, startup exposure, and innovation-driven thinking can be brought into the classroom to better prepare students for tomorrow’s challenges.

We look forward to more such academia-industry interactions that nurture a stronger entrepreneurial culture on campuses! 🌱💡

Dr.Premachandra Sagar | Rohan Prem Sagar | Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Daamini Sharma | Dr. Adithya Hande
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering Bangalore | Dayananda Sagar Institutions | Don Bosco Institute of Technology (DBIT), Bengaluru

#FacultyDevelopment #DERBIFoundation #InnovationCampus #DSBA #StartupIndia #AcademiaToInnovation #EntrepreneurialMindset #FutureReadyEducation #IncubationEcosystem #KudluGate #InnovationTour

We at DERBI Foundation, were delighted to host Dr.Panneerselvam ( PS ) Madanagopal, CEO of MeitY Startup Hub, to review the progress of the #MeitY_SAMRIDH accelerator program and explore deeper collaboration.

Dr. Madanagopal toured our incubation and innovation infrastructure, interacted with our team, and had insightful discussions around our strategy to support high-potential startups working in deeptech startups

He also engaged with the SAMRIDH startup cohort, listening to their journeys and feedback on how the program is helping them build scalable, impactful ventures, with support from MeitY Startup Hub and the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

We’re excited to deepen our partnership and continue enabling early-stage startups with the resources, mentorship, and market access they need to succeed.

Looking forward to accelerating more digital-first, impact-driven innovations with MeitY Startup Hub!

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma
Pankaj Anand | Sajid Raza | 

Prodoc AI | SUIND | AmpCycle | Indifoot Sports | Lifespark Technologies | 

#MeitYSAMRIDH #StartupIndia #MeitYStartupHub #DERBIFoundation #DigitalHealth #ImpactInnovation #AcceleratorProgram #StartupEcosystem #Healthtech #InnovationInIndia

🎯 Thank You, Mr. Jagan karthick! 🎯

We're thrilled to have hosted Mr. Jagan Karthick for a deep-dive workshop on #Design_Thinking — a session that empowered our startups to think empathetically, ideate boldly, and validate early.

With a structured walkthrough of the Design Thinking framework —

Empathize → Define → Ideate → Prototype → Test → Iterate
 — Jagan brought clarity on how to approach product development in a user-centric way.

The session featured powerful startup case studies — showing how design thinking drives real-world innovation.

Key takeaways also included:
 ✅ Strategies for early customer validation
 ✅ Brand differentiation for new markets
 ✅ A sneak peek into pre-incubation planning for low-engaged startups
Thank you, Jagan, for helping our founders sharpen their lens on problem-solving, positioning, and scaling with purpose. 🙌

#DesignThinking #StartupAcceleration #UserCentricInnovation #FounderMindset #DERBIFoundation #MentorshipMatters #InnovationJourney #EarlyStageStartups #ThankYou

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | MeitY Startup Hub | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) | Startup India | Startup Karnataka |

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
In agriculture, productivity is only part of the story. 

Without efficient post-harvest systems, much of what’s grown is lost, or sold at distress prices. 

Farmers need access to infrastructure that preserves produce quality, extends shelf-life life, and enables value addition. For perishable crops, in particular, the time between harvest and sale is critical. 

We’re inviting start-ups developing solutions for: 

- Affordable, accessible preservation and processing 
- Modular storage with hybrid or passive cooling 
- Off-grid or decentralised post-harvest infrastructure 
- Quality monitoring, grading, and traceability 

Solutions should be relevant to smallholder farmers, and adaptable to a range of crops and geographies. 
 
Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and design support, incubation, mentorship, and access to scale-up networks.
 
Applications close on 13th July 2025. Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony
 
#FarmingForward #PostHarvestInnovation #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

#NewBlogAlert: Climate change isn’t tomorrow’s problem, it’s today’s reality. Its health impacts are already worsening global inequalities, with a 68% increase in heat-related deaths among vulnerable populations. The effects extend beyond physical health, climate change is taking a serious toll on mental health too, with climate anxiety rising sharply, especially among young people.

In our latest blog, our Board member, and the founder of Social Alpha, Manoj Kumar explores how climate volatility is disrupting disease ecology and why we need an innovation-driven ecosystem to anticipate, adapt, and protect both present and future generations.

Read Now: http://bit.ly/3T7Ka7B

#IndiaHealthFund #ClimateChange #ClimateHealthInnovation #HealthcareChallenges

Impact investing and blended finance were supposed to fund what the market wouldn’t—ideas that are too early, too complex, too local, or too long-term. Instead, they have become vehicles for funding what the market already wants, just with less risk and more narrative dressing.

#DeshpandeStartups #BharatStartups #StartupJobs #LeadershipRoles #Entrepreneurship #HardwareInnovation #StudentEntrepreneurship #Careers #Hiring #MakeInIndia

We recently hosted a fantastic "Founder's Playbook: Smart Moves for Sustainable Startups" hybrid session, engaging around 30 entrepreneurs both online and in our auditorium! It was a powerful experience diving into strategic growth for new startups.

The session, expertly led by Dipanjay Bhalerao, Deputy Director, Indira Institute of Management, Pune (MBA), offered practical and thought-provoking insights:

• Strategic Startup Categorization: Participants gained clarity on distinguishing between High/Low Investment and Innovation models, prompting them to assess their own ventures.

• The B.I.O. Model: Mr. Bhalerao introduced his impactful Business, Investment, and Offering Innovation model, illustrated with compelling examples of capex reduction, smart outsourcing (like Airtel), and revenue streams (like Apple's app ecosystem).

• Innovation vs. Disruption: A crucial discussion that provided a clearer understanding of these pivotal concepts.

• The Power of Collaboration: Emphasizing how partnerships drive significant growth in the startup ecosystem.

A huge thank you to Dipanjay Bhalerao for sharing his profound knowledge and making the session so valuable. We also extend our gratitude to all the entrepreneurs who actively participated and made this event a resounding success!

Padmaraj Pattanashetti | ABHISHEK kajagar | Vishwadharmi K Sharma | Karan SG Doddwad | Vaibhav Dhulla | Ayush Shetty | Soumya Chaugala | Prashant Pammar

#DeshpandeStartups #FoundersPlaybook #StartupInsights #Entrepreneurship #HybridSession #Innovation #CommunityEngagement

https://www.linkedin.com/company/venture.text:
Ready-to-Use Labs, Offices, and Desks and much more at India's largest incubator for science and technology based startups! Come.... 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝘂𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘂𝘀!

Venture Center is an award winning, leading incubator for deeptech, knowledge intensive startups, and our 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝗰𝘂𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺 for startups offers a range of benefits—without taking any equity!

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

Access to seed funds, CSR funds, and government grants for different stages of your journey.

4. Prime Location

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities. 

6. Vibrant peer group community on our campus

Surround yourself with like-minded innovators and entrepreneurs who can inspire and support your startup journey. 

𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆! We're looking for startups with an innovative idea or technology in the early stages with a scalable business model!

This July, we're organizing a Hands-On Workshop in Science, Design & Engineering for curious minds aged 10 - 15 years! 

This unique, hands-on learning experience — the Floating Table Workshop, is designed to introduce students to tensegrity engineering, digital design (CAD), and laser cutting in a fun and engaging format. Participants will explore structure, design with CAD, and build a working model using laser-cut parts—all in a day.

- Discover the principles of tensegrity structures
- Design a table using beginner-friendly CAD software
- Watch it take shape with laser cutting tools
- Take home a personalized, self-made floating table

Venue: The Protoshop, Venture Center, NCL Innovation Park
Date: 26 July 2025
Time: 9:30 AM – 5:30 PM
Fee: INR 1500

No prior experience is needed—just a curious mind and a willingness to create.

Floating seats, limited availability - secure yours now.

Dr. Prakash Chandra Saini, Director – Sales, Ruminant at Kemin Industries, recently visited Venture Center’s newly inaugurated Food Feed Nutrition Lab, engaging directly with startups building impactful solutions in the food-feed-nutrition space.

Dr. Saini’s visit was part of Kemin Industries’ partnership with Venture Center to advancing social impact through its CSR initiatives. He spent time interacting with Proxi Farma, sampling their innovative nutrition products, and engaging with Green Pyramid (pictured), gaining first-hand insight into how CSR-backed equipment donations empower startups to translate lab-scale ideas into real-world solutions.

For many deep-tech startups addressing pressing social challenges, early access to well-equipped labs is the critical first step toward building technologies that can transform lives. It was invaluable for our CSR partner, Kemin Industries, to see how the equipment (moisture analyzer and CHNOS elemental analyzer) they have supported is actively enabling entrepreneurs to develop solutions for a more sustainable and nourished world.

Thank you, Kemin Industries , for your thoughtful and impactful CSR support!

Dr. SANTOSH VYAS Kemin Industries South Asia Pvt Ltd. Namita Joshi Premnath Venugopalan Asmita Prabhune Madhur Motwani MBBS PhD

Ready to transform your hardware innovation into reality? Connect with our team to explore how DST Prayas Shala can support your venture.

Over the past two weeks, VentureStudio hosted two engaging events that brought together students, makers, and founders from across the ecosystem.

We began with a hands-on 3D Printing Workshop at DST Prayas Shala, where participants explored the fundamentals of additive manufacturing, from basic design principles to operating a 3D printer. Attendees created their own prototypes and gained practical exposure to tools that enable rapid innovation. 

This was followed by a powerful panel discussion on "Building Startup Teams and Company Culture," featuring founders who’ve built successful ventures across sectors. Dr. Purav Gandhi (Healthark), Aenik Shah (Wizzy.ai), Abhishek Acharya (Theka Coffee), Shalin (Shawn) Parikh (MYCPE ONE), Shrijay Sheth (LegalWiz.in) and Jatin Chaudhary (eChai Ventures) shared hard-earned insights on hiring, values, and leadership. The room was filled with students, early-stage entrepreneurs, and professionals eager to learn what it really takes to build cohesive, high-performing teams.

Thank you to all the speakers and participants for making these sessions impactful. Stay tuned for more events from VentureStudio.

#Innovation #Entrepreneurship #3DPrinting #StartupCulture #AhmedabadUniversity #StartupIndia #DesignToPrototype #Founders #TeamBuilding
